intro: Hebe subfulvida, commonly known as the golden hebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, typically blooming in spring. Hebe subfulvida prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to thrive in a variety of climates, though it is best suited to temperate regions.
